abstract: While plummeting oil prices are cutting into profits, they are not threatening big banks’ capital cushions, analysts say, thanks to rigorous regulation.
snippet: While plummeting oil prices are cutting into profits, they are not threatening big banks’ capital cushions, analysts say, thanks to rigorous regulation.
lead_paragraph: Low oil prices are rattling global markets and destabilizing economies around the world. They are also posing one of the first big tests to the United States banking system since the financial crisis.

headline.main: Oil Market Tests Banks’ Ability to Weather Losses
headline.print_headline: Oil Market Tests Banks on Ability to Take Loss
